content.en:
The Lancer TTRPG (Tabletop Roleplaying Game) is a science-fiction RPG designed by Miguel Lopez and Tom Parkinson-Morgan, published by Massif Press. It is a game about mech combat in a distant future where humanity has spread to the stars.

Lancer offers deep, modular mech customization, a wide range of player backgrounds and hooks to prompt storytelling, and a system and setting with room for any narrative you and your group want to tell. It’s best with a group of 3-5 players, and can be used to run a one-shot session or persistent campaign.

title.fr: Jets de compétence, attaques et sauvegardes
title.it: Tiri di Abilità, Attacchi e Tiri Salvezza
title.es: Tiradas de habilidad, ataques y salvaciones

content.en:
There are three types of dice rolls in Lancer: skill checks, attacks, and saves. 

In narrative play, you will only need to worry about the first of these. In mech combat you will use all three. 

You make skill checks when your character is in a challenging or tense situation that requires effort to overcome. When you want to act in such a situation, state your objective (e.g., break down the door, decrypt the data, or sweet-talk the guard), then roll 1d20, and add any relevant bonuses. On a total of 10+, you succeed. A result of 9 or less means you failed to accomplish your goal and may suffer consequences as a result. Although the GM can’t change the target number (10), they have access to several tools that are explained later (p. 45-47), such as declaring a skill challenge or deciding that your action is DIFFICULT or RISKY. 

In mech combat, attacks are any offensive actions against other characters, like firing a weapon or hacking into an opponent’s mech. Attack rolls are similar to skill checks – you roll 1d20 and add any bonuses – but the target number isn’t always 10, and usually depends on the defensive capabilities of your target. For an attack to be successful it needs to equal or exceed the target’s defense. Successful attacks are described as “hits” - so if the rules tell you that an effect happens “on hit”, that means it takes place when you make a successful attack. Some attacks also result in critical hits. On a roll of 20+ you perform a critical hit, which allows you to deal more damage or sometimes trigger extra effects. 

Although there are different types of attacks, including ranged, melee, and tech attacks, they all use the same basic rules described here. 

Lastly, saves are rolls made to avoid or resist negative effects in mech combat. You might roll a save to prevent a hacker wrecking your systems, to avoid being blinded by a flash grenade, or to dive away from an explosion. To save, you roll 1d20 and add any bonuses, but the target number can differ from 10 as it can with attacks. The target number for a save usually depends on the abilities of the attacker. If you equal or exceed this number, you succeed; if your roll is lower, you fail. The outcome of each result will depend on what you are trying to avoid.

In some cases, the rules will tell you to make a contested check, representing a challenge between two parties. In a contested check, both participants make skill checks and add any bonuses. Whoever has the highest result wins. If the result is a tie, the attacker – the one who initiated the contest – wins. 

You might make contested checks in both narrative play and mech combat.

Bei einem umstrittenen Wurf machen beide Teilnehmer Fertigkeitswürfe und fügen alle Boni hinzu. Wer das höchste Ergebnis hat, gewinnt. Bei einem Unentschieden gewinnt der Angreifer – derjenige, der den Wettbewerb initiiert hat.

Sie können umstrittene Würfe sowohl im narrativen Spiel als auch im Mech-Kampf machen.

Dans un jet contesté, les deux participants font des jets de compétence et ajoutent tous les bonus. Celui qui a le résultat le plus élevé gagne. En cas d'égalité, l'attaquant – celui qui a initié le concours – gagne.

Vous pouvez faire des jets contestés à la fois dans le jeu narratif et dans le combat de mech.

In un tiro contestato, entrambi i partecipanti effettuano tiri abilità e aggiungono tutti i bonus. Chi ha il risultato più alto vince. In caso di parità, vince l'attaccante – colui che ha iniziato la gara.

Puoi effettuare tiri contestati sia nel gioco narrativo che nel combattimento meccanico.

En una tirada en disputa, ambos participantes hacen tiradas de habilidad y añaden cualquier bonificación. Quien tenga el resultado más alto gana. Si el resultado es un empate, el atacante – el que inició el concurso – gana.

content.en:
ACCURACY and DIFFICULTY are temporary modifiers gained and lost in rapid, chaotic moments of action.

For example, two mech pilots, equally matched, duel amidst the shifting debris of a shattered frigate. Attempting to land a shot, they dodge to avoid incoming fire and floating, slagged bulkheads. The debris makes it unlikely that either will land a clean hit; however, one of the pilots, thinking quickly, hides among the floating metal. When their enemy gets close, the pilot springs forth from hiding and catches their opponent unaware – making the shot much easier than normal.

Situations like this can cause pilots to gain ACCURACY or DIFFICULTY.

  • Each point of ACCURACY adds 1d6 to a roll.
  • Each point of DIFFICULTY subtracts 1d6 from a roll.
  • ACCURACY and DIFFICULTY cancel each other out on a 1:1 basis.

If you are lucky enough to be rolling several of the same bonus dice, whether ACCURACY or DIFFICULTY, you don’t add them together to determine the result. Instead, find the highest number rolled and apply it to the final roll. Because of this, no roll can ever receive more than –6 or +6 from ACCURACY or DIFFICULTY.

For example:

  • For an attack with 2 ACCURACY, roll 2d6 and choose the highest of the two dice, then add that number to your attack roll. If you roll 3 on one die and 4 on the other, you add +4 to the roll, not +7.
  • For an attack with 2 ACCURACY and 1 DIFFICULTY, you only add 1d6 to your attack roll as 1 DIFFICULTY and 1 ACCURACY cancel each other out.
  • For an attack with 1 ACCURACY and 1 DIFFICULTY, you don’t add anything to the roll – the dice cancel each other out.

Pilots are lucky and unique individuals, multi-talented and resilient. Even so, brand-new pilots don’t measure up to tempered, battle-hardened veterans when push comes to shove. The benefits of experience are measured by GRIT, a bonus that reflects your pilot’s deep reservoirs of resolve and will to live.

GRIT is half of your character’s license level, rounded up. It improves attack bonuses, hit points, and save targets for both your pilot and your mech.

content.en:
Unlike in other roleplaying games, in Lancer you don’t need to track currency. Your access to mechs, gear, upgrades, talents, and other character options is instead restricted by licenses. Licenses represent access to the valuable information, resources, and authority required to acquire mech gear and parts. They are tightly controlled by the major powers in Lancer and allow their holders unlimited access to their included gear. 

In Lancer, your pilot progresses by completing missions and gaining license levels (LL). Your LL applies to both your pilot and your mech – as you level up, both parts of your character become stronger and gain access to more advanced gear and combat techniques. Increasing it allows you to unlock new manufacturer licenses, opening the door to exclusive gear and mechs. Leveling up also allows your pilot to improve their triggers, mech skills, and GRIT, and lets you choose talents to further customize your play style. 

A new pilot typically starts at LL0 – an inexperienced rookie – and levels up to LL1 after their first mission, then again after each subsequent mission to a maximum of LL12.

New players should usually create characters at LL0. Even at this level, your pilot has access to an extensive range of bonuses and gear. 

LL0 characters start with the following: 

  • A background, which provides bonuses on skill checks. 
  • Four +2 pilot triggers.
  • One +2 mech skill or two +1 mech skills. 
  • Three rank 1 talents.
  • A license for all General Massive Systems (GMS) gear and weapons, and one mech FRAME - the GMS-SP1 Everest.

When characters complete a mission, whether they succeeded or failed, their LL increases by one and they add:

  • +2 to an existing trigger or a new trigger at +2.
  • +1 to a mech skill. 
  • +1 talent rank to choose a new talent or improve an existing one. 
  • +1 license rank to spend on mech talents and licenses. 

Leveling up naturally increases a pilot’s GRIT, which is equal to 1/2 a pilot’s total LL, rounded up. Pilots gain their first point of GRIT at LL1. 

At every third LL (3, 6, 9, and 12), pilots also get to choose a new core bonus – a powerful improvement to all mechs they build.

The most important thing to remember when leveling up is that you only choose or increase the rank of one license at a time, getting access to no more than two weapons or pieces of gear with each increase. Planning out a long-term strategy might seem difficult, but you can always retrofit licenses as you level up, so you’re never locked into decisions. Explore what seems interesting to you and try out different mechs!

title.ja: ポイントの再割り当て

content.en:
Every time your pilot’s LL increases, you also have the option to choose one: 

  • Reallocate all ranks from one of your talents to any other talent.
  • Reallocate all ranks from one of your licenses to any other license.
  • Replace one core bonus with another core bonus for which your pilot qualifies.

If reallocating ranks from one license to another means your pilot no longer qualifies for a core bonus, you must replace that core bonus with one you now qualify for.

라이선스에서 다른 라이선스로 랭크를 재할당하는 것이 당신의 파이로트가 더 이상 코어 보너스의 자격이 없다는 것을 의미한다면, 당신은 그 코어 보너스를 당신이 지금 자격이 있는 코어 보너스로 대체해야 합니다.

content.en:
Clocks are an extremely simple tool for GMs to use during narrative play to track complicated tasks, set criteria for success or failure, or ratchet up the tension. Clocks can be used in any Lancer session or campaign.

By a ‘clock’ we mean an actual clock, a little circle that’s split into segments. You can draw them out on a piece of paper or a battle map. 

Clocks aren’t meant to be used for every action in the game – just ones that will take a little more time or skill to complete. They can be used instead of skill challenges as they serve a similar purpose. They’re intended for use in narrative play, rather than combat.

Setting up a clock is very easy. First, decide what the clock represents (or the consequences of filling it up), then draw out a circle with an even number of segments (four, six, eight, ten, or twelve). The more segments a clock has, the more complicated the task is and the longer it will take. Basic clocks should have four or six segments, and a ten or twelve segment clock with take a long time to fill out so only use it for the most complicated or long-term of tasks or goals.

You can set out clocks to track complex tasks or challenges, such as chases, battles, or the invention of a new device in a workshop. These are called task clocks. When a character takes an action that relates to a clock and their action is successful or effective (usually a result of 10–19), fill in two segments. If they failed or the action was ineffective (usually a result of 0–9) fill in either one segment or none. If the action was very effective (or the player rolled a 20+), fill in three segments. A good way to ensure that a situation stays dynamic is to tick one segment even on a failure, but you don’t necessarily have to do so. 

Using clocks to represent complicated tasks ensures you’re only rolling when there’s persistent narrative tension, constrains the number of rolls made for any given task, and creates clear parameters for success. It allows the story to progress and means you don’t have to waste time lingering on tasks that would otherwise require a lot of rolling, all of which we find extremely effective for speeding up play.

You can also use clocks to track the status or time pressure of a larger ongoing situation in the world or campaign, such as a war, a faction’s political influence, or an assassination plot. These progress clocks tend to move by themselves without any influence from the players. Tick segments on these clocks when the story or campaign moves forward. A good time to do this is after the players complete a period of downtime. When ticking these clocks, tick one segment if the situation progressed a little, two if it progressed as normal, and three if there was great progress. For example, if you have a clock tracking the progress of a war and it’s drawing to a close, you might tick three segments on that clock at the end of downtime
content.ru: Вы также можете использовать часы для отслеживания статуса или временного давления более крупной текущей ситуации в мире или кампании, такой как война, политическое влияние фракции или заговор на убийство. Эти часы прогресса обычно движутся сами по себе без какого-либо влияния со стороны игроков. Отмечайте сегменты на этих часах, когда история или кампания продвигается вперед. Хорошее время для этого - после того, как игроки завершат период простоя. Когда отмечаются эти часы, отмечайте один сегмент, если ситуация продвинулась немного, два, если она продвинулась как обычно, и три, если был большой прогресс. Например, если у вас есть часы, отслеживающие прогресс войны, и они подходят к концу, вы можете отметить три сегмента на этих часах в конце простоя
content.ja: また、戦争、派閥の政治的影響力、暗殺計画など、世界やキャンペーンの中で進行中の大きな状況の状態や時間的な圧力を追跡するためにクロックを使用することもできます。これらの進行クロックは、プレイヤーからの影響なしに自分で動く傾向があります。物語やキャンペーンが前進したときに、これらのクロックのセグメントをチェックします。これを行うのに最適な時期は、プレイヤーがダウンタイムを完了した後です。これらのクロックをチックするときは、状況が少し進んだ場合は1つのセグメントを、通常通り進んだ場合は2つのセグメントを、大きな進歩があった場合は3つのセグメントをチックします。たとえば、戦争の進行状況を追跡するクロックがあり、終盤に近づいている場合、ダウンタイムの終わりにそのクロックの3つのセグメントをチックすることができます
content.es: También puedes usar relojes para rastrear el estado o la presión de tiempo de una situación más grande en curso en el mundo o la campaña, como una guerra, la influencia política de una facción o un complot de asesinato. Estos relojes de progreso tienden a moverse por sí mismos sin ninguna influencia de los jugadores. Marca los segmentos de estos relojes cuando la historia o la campaña avance. Un buen momento para hacer esto es después de que los jugadores completen un período de inactividad. Cuando marques estos relojes, marca un segmento si la situación avanzó un poco, dos si avanzó normalmente y tres si hubo un gran progreso. Por ejemplo, si tienes un reloj que rastrea el progreso de una guerra y está llegando a su fin, podrías marcar tres segmentos en ese reloj al final de la inactividad
content.zh: 您还可以使用时钟来跟踪世界或战役中正在进行的更大情况的状态或时间压力，例如战争，派系的政治影响力或暗杀阴谋。这些进度时钟往往会自行移动，而不受玩家的任何影响。当故事或战役前进时，勾选这些时钟的段。这样做的好时机是在玩家完成休息时间后。当勾选这些时钟时，如果情况有所进展，则勾选一个段，如果情况正常，则勾选两个段，如果情况有很大进展，则勾选三个段。例如，如果您有一个跟踪战争进展的时钟，并且它即将结束，您可以在休息时间结束时在该时钟上勾选三个段
content.de: Sie können Uhren auch verwenden, um den Status oder den Zeitdruck einer größeren laufenden Situation in der Welt oder der Kampagne zu verfolgen, wie zum Beispiel einem Krieg, dem politischen Einfluss einer Fraktion oder einer Attentatsverschwörung. Diese Fortschrittsuhren bewegen sich in der Regel von selbst, ohne Einflussnahme der Spieler. Setzen Sie Ticks auf diesen Uhren, wenn sich die Geschichte oder die Kampagne vorwärts bewegt. Ein guter Zeitpunkt dafür ist nachdem die Spieler eine Phase der Inaktivität abgeschlossen haben. Beim Setzen dieser Ticks setzen Sie einen Tick, wenn sich die Situation ein wenig entwickelt hat, zwei, wenn sie sich normal entwickelt hat, und drei, wenn es einen großen Fortschritt gab. Zum Beispiel, wenn Sie eine Uhr haben, die den Fortschritt eines Krieges verfolgt und er sich dem Ende nähert, könnten Sie am Ende der Inaktivitätsphase drei Ticks auf dieser Uhr setzen.
content.fr: Vous pouvez également utiliser des horloges pour suivre l'état ou la pression temporelle d'une situation plus vaste en cours dans le monde ou la campagne, tels qu'une guerre, l'influence politique d'une faction ou un complot d'assassinat. Ces horloges de progression ont tendance à avancer d'elles-mêmes sans aucune influence des joueurs. Faites avancer les segments de ces horloges lorsque l'histoire ou la campagne avance. Un bon moment pour le faire est après que les joueurs aient terminé une période de temps mort. Lorsque vous faites avancer ces horloges, faites avancer un segment si la situation a progressé un peu, deux si elle a progressé normalement et trois s'il y a eu un grand progrès. Par exemple, si vous avez une horloge qui suit l'avancée d'une guerre et qu'elle touche à sa fin, vous pourriez faire avancer trois segments sur cette horloge à la fin de la période de temps mort.
content.it: Puoi anche utilizzare orologi per tenere traccia dello stato o della pressione temporale di una situazione più ampia in corso nel mondo o nella campagna, come ad esempio una guerra, l'influenza politica di una fazione o un complotto di assassinio. Questi orologi di progresso tendono a muoversi da soli senza alcuna influenza da parte dei giocatori. Fai avanzare i segmenti di questi orologi quando la storia o la campagna procede. Un buon momento per farlo è dopo che i giocatori hanno completato un periodo di inattività. Quando fai avanzare questi orologi, fai avanzare un segmento se la situazione è progredita leggermente, due se è progredita normalmente e tre se c'è stato un grande progresso. Ad esempio, se hai un orologio che tiene traccia dell'avanzamento di una guerra e sta per concludersi, potresti far avanzare tre segmenti su quell'orologio alla fine del periodo di inattività.
content.ko: 세계나 캠페인 내에서 진행 중인 대규모 상황의 상태나 시간적 압박을 추적하기 위해 시계(clock)를 사용할 수도 있습니다. 이는 전쟁, 세력의 정치적 영향력 또는 암살 계획과 같은 상황을 대표합니다. 이러한 진행 상황 시계는 플레이어의 영향을 받지 않고 스스로 움직이는 경향이 있습니다. 이야기나 캠페인이 진행될 때 이러한 시계의 분절을 이동시킵니다. 플레이어가 휴식 시간을 완료한 후에 이를 수행하는 것이 좋습니다. 이러한 시계를 이동할 때 상황이 약간 진전되었다면 한 분절, 보통 진전이 있었다면 두 분절, 큰 진전이 있었다면 세 분절을 이동시킵니다. 예를 들어, 전쟁의 진행 상황을 추적하는 시계가 마무리 단계에 접어들면, 휴식 시간의 끝에 그 시계에서 세 분절을 이동시킬 수 있습니다.

content.en: When all of a clock’s segments have been filled in, the consequence or outcome that it tracks comes to pass, or the situation it represents is resolved. You can usually erase the clock, but sometimes completing one clock starts another one! You might fill out the Chase clock to chase down a bounty hunter, but now you’re setting out an Interrogation clock to get information from them.
content.ru: Когда все сегменты часов заполнены, последствие или результат, который они отслеживают, происходит, или ситуация, которую они представляют, разрешается. Вы обычно можете стереть часы, но иногда заполнение одних часов запускает другие! Вы можете заполнить часы Chase для преследования охотника за головами, но теперь вы устанавливаете Interrogation для получения от них информации.
content.ja: すべてのクロックのセグメントが埋まったら、それが追跡する結果や結果が発生するか、それが表す状況が解決されます。通常、クロックを消去できますが、1つのクロックを完了すると別のクロックが開始される場合があります！ Chaseクロックを埋めて賞金稼ぎを追跡することができますが、今度はInterrogationクロックを設定して情報を入手します。
content.es: Cuando todos los segmentos de un reloj se han completado, la consecuencia o resultado que rastrea se produce, o la situación que representa se resuelve. Por lo general, puede borrar el reloj, ¡pero a veces completar un reloj inicia otro! Puede completar el reloj Chase para perseguir a un cazarrecompensas, pero ahora está estableciendo un reloj Interrogation para obtener información de ellos.
content.zh: 当所有时钟的段都填满时，它所跟踪的后果或结果就会发生，或者它所代表的情况就会解决。您通常可以擦除时钟，但有时完成一个时钟会启动另一个时钟！您可以填写Chase时钟以追捕赏金猎人，但现在您正在设置Interrogation时钟以从他们那里获得信息。
content.de: Wenn alle Segmente einer Uhr ausgefüllt sind, tritt die Konsequenz oder das Ergebnis, das sie verfolgt, ein, oder die Situation, die sie darstellt, wird gelöst. Sie können die Uhr normalerweise löschen, aber manchmal startet das Ausfüllen einer Uhr eine andere! Sie können die Chase Uhr ausfüllen, um einen Kopfgeldjäger zu jagen, aber jetzt stellen Sie eine Interrogation Uhr ein, um Informationen von ihnen zu erhalten.
content.fr: Lorsque tous les segments d’une horloge ont été remplis, la conséquence ou le résultat qu’elle suit se produit, ou la situation qu’elle représente est résolue. Vous pouvez généralement effacer l’horloge, mais parfois, en complétant une horloge, vous en démarrez une autre ! Vous pouvez remplir l’horloge Chase pour traquer un chasseur de primes, mais maintenant vous mettez en place une horloge Interrogation pour obtenir des informations d’eux.
content.it: Quando tutti i segmenti di un orologio sono stati riempiti, la conseguenza o il risultato che traccia si verifica, o la situazione che rappresenta viene risolta. Di solito puoi cancellare l’orologio, ma a volte completarne uno ne avvia un altro! Potresti riempire l’orologio Chase per inseguire un cacciatore di taglie, ma ora stai impostando un orologio Interrogation per ottenere informazioni da loro.
content.ko: 시계의 모든 세그먼트가 채워지면 추적하는 결과 또는 결과가 발생하거나 나타내는 상황이 해결됩니다. 일반적으로 시계를 지울 수 있지만 때로는 하나의 시계를 완성하면 다른 시계가 시작됩니다! Chase시계를 채워서 현상 수배자를 추적 할 수 있지만 이제는 Interrogation시계를 설정하여 그들로부터 정보를 얻습니다.

content.en: You can also create clocks that fill up as a result of failures, rather than successes, establishing fail states for situations. These clocks get filled in as consequences of failed rolls or complications of RISKY rolls. For example, if a group of PCs were trying to flee from a band of mercenaries, you might set out two clocks: one that represents the PCs’ safe escape and one that represents the mercenaries catching up to them and forcing a fight. The Escape clock fills up when PCs successfully put some distance between them and their pursuers, while the Capture clock fills up when they either fail those actions or have to make trade-offs. You might fill in two segments whenever a PC fails a roll and fill in a single segment if they succeed on a RISKY roll.
content.ru: Вы также можете создавать часы, которые заполняются в результате неудач, а не успехов, устанавливая состояния отказа для ситуаций. Эти часы заполняются в качестве последствий неудачных бросков или осложнений RISKY rolls. Например, если группа ПК пыталась убежать от отряда наемников, вы можете установить два часа: один, который представляет безопасный побег ПК, и один, который представляет наемников, догоняющих их и заставляющих драться. Escape часы заполняются, когда ПК успешно удаляются от преследователей, а Capture часы заполняются, когда они либо не выполняют эти действия, либо вынуждены идти на компромисс. Вы можете заполнить два сегмента, когда ПК неудачно бросает кубики, и заполнить один сегмент, если они успешно выполняют RISKY бросок.
content.ja: 成功ではなく失敗の結果として、状況の失敗状態を確立することで、満たされるクロックを作成することもできます。これらのクロックは、失敗したロールの結果またはRISKY ロールの合併症として埋められます。たとえば、PCたちの一団が傭兵団から逃げようとしている場合、PCたちの安全な脱出を表す1つと、傭兵団が彼らに追いついて戦いを強いることを表す1つのクロックを設定することができます。 Escape クロックは、PCが追跡者との間に距離を置くことに成功したときに満たされ、Capture クロックは、それらのアクションに失敗するか、トレードオフを行う必要があるときに満たされます。 PCがロールに失敗した場合は2つのセグメントを埋め、RISKY ロールに成功した場合は1つのセグメントを埋めることができます。
content.es: También puedes crear relojes que se llenen como resultado de fallos, en lugar de éxitos, estableciendo estados de fallo para situaciones. Estos relojes se llenan como consecuencias de tiradas fallidas o complicaciones de tiradas RISKY. Por ejemplo, si un grupo de PJs intenta huir de una banda de mercenarios, podrías establecer dos relojes: uno que representa la huida segura de los PJs y otro que representa a los mercenarios alcanzándolos y forzando un combate. El reloj de Escape se llena cuando los PJs consiguen poner distancia entre ellos y sus perseguidores, mientras que el reloj de Capture se llena cuando fallan esas acciones o tienen que hacer concesiones. Podrías llenar dos segmentos cada vez que un PJ falla una tirada y un solo segmento si tienen éxito en una tirada RISKY.
content.zh: 您还可以创建在失败而不是成功的情况下填充的时钟，从而为情况建立失败状态。这些时钟填充为失败的掷骰结果或 RISKY 掷骰的并发症。例如，如果一组PC试图从一群雇佣兵中逃脱，您可以设置两个时钟：一个代表PC的安全逃脱，另一个代表雇佣兵追上他们并迫使他们战斗。 逃脱时钟在PC成功将他们和追捕者之间的距离拉开时填满，而捕获时钟在他们失败这些动作或不得不做出让步时填满。如果PC失败了掷骰，您可以填写两个片段，如果他们在 RISKY 掷骰上成功，您可以填写一个片段。
content.de: Sie können auch Uhren erstellen, die als Folge von Fehlern und nicht von Erfolgen gefüllt werden, indem Sie Fehlerzustände für Situationen festlegen. Diese Uhren werden als Folge von fehlgeschlagenen Würfen oder Komplikationen von RISKY Würfen gefüllt. Wenn sich die Gruppe der SCs zum Beispiel von einer Söldnertruppe absetzen will, können Sie zwei Uhren einstellen: eine, die die sichere Flucht der SCs darstellt, und eine, die die Söldner darstellt, die sie einholen und zu einem Kampf zwingen. Die Escape Uhr wird gefüllt, wenn die SCs es schaffen, Abstand zwischen sich und ihren Verfolgern zu bringen, während die Capture Uhr gefüllt wird, wenn sie diese Aktionen nicht schaffen oder Zugeständnisse machen müssen. Sie könnten zwei Segmente füllen, wenn ein SC einen Wurf vermasselt, und ein einziges Segment, wenn er einen RISKY Wurf schafft.
content.fr: Vous pouvez également créer des horloges qui se remplissent en cas d'échec plutôt que de succès, en établissant des états d'échec pour les situations. Ces horloges se remplissent en conséquence d'un jet raté ou de complications d'un jet RISKY. Par exemple, si un groupe de PJ tente de s'échapper d'une bande de mercenaires, vous pouvez établir deux horloges : l'une représentant l'évasion en toute sécurité des PJ et l'autre représentant les mercenaires les rattrapant et les forçant à combattre. L'horloge Escape se remplit lorsque les PJ parviennent à mettre de la distance entre eux et leurs poursuivants, tandis que l'horloge Capture se remplit lorsqu'ils échouent dans ces actions ou doivent faire des concessions. Vous pourriez remplir deux segments chaque fois qu'un PJ rate un jet et un seul segment s'il réussit un jet RISKY.
content.it: Puoi anche creare orologi che si riempiono come risultato di fallimenti anziché di successi, stabilendo stati di fallimento per le situazioni. Questi orologi si riempiono come conseguenza di un tiro fallito o di complicazioni di un tiro RISKY. Ad esempio, se un gruppo di PG cerca di fuggire da una banda di mercenari, potresti stabilire due orologi: uno che rappresenta la fuga sicura dei PG e un altro che rappresenta i mercenari che li raggiungono e li costringono a combattere. L'orologio Escape si riempie quando i PG riescono a mettere distanza tra loro e i loro inseguitori, mentre l'orologio Capture si riempie quando falliscono in quelle azioni o devono fare delle concessioni. Potresti riempire due segmenti ogni volta che un PG fallisce un tiro e un solo segmento se riesce in un tiro RISKY.
content.ko: 상황에 실패 상태를 설정하여 실패가 성공보다 더 많은 시계를 생성할 수도 있습니다. 이러한 시계는 실패한 굴림 또는 RISKY 굴림의 합병증으로 인해 채워집니다. 예를 들어, PC 그룹이 용병단에서 탈출하려고하는 경우 두 개의 시계를 설정할 수 있습니다. 하나는 PC의 안전한 탈출을 나타내고 다른 하나는 용병단이 그들을 따라잡고 싸우도록하는 것을 나타냅니다. Escape시계는 PC가 자신과 추격자 사이의 거리를 벌릴 때 채워지고 Capture시계는 그들이 이러한 행동을 실패하거나 양보해야 할 때 채워집니다. PC가 굴림을 실패하면 두 세그먼트를 채우고 RISKY 굴림에 성공하면 하나의 세그먼트를 채울 수 있습니다.

title.ja: クロックのチェックを外す

content.en: Filled-in clock segments can also be erased if action is taken to reverse an action or situation. In the pursuit scenario described above, for example, the PCs might try something to clear segments from the Capture clock instead of filling in segments on the Escape clock. This could involve putting down a false trail, blocking off a door, or splitting up.
content.ru: Заполненные сегменты часов также можно стереть, если предприняты действия по обращению действия или ситуации. В сценарии преследования, описанном выше, например, ПК могут попытаться что-то сделать, чтобы очистить сегменты из Захвата часов вместо заполнения сегментов на Побег часы. Это может включать в себя установку ложного следа, блокировку двери или разделение.
content.ja: 埋め込まれたクロックセグメントは、アクションを逆転させるためのアクションが取られた場合にも消去できます。たとえば、上記の追跡シナリオでは、PCは脱出クロックのセグメントを埋める代わりに捕獲クロックからセグメントを消去するために何かを試すかもしれません。これには、偽のトレイルを置く、ドアをブロックする、または分割するなどが含まれる可能性があります。
content.es: Los segmentos de reloj llenos también se pueden borrar si se toma una acción para revertir una acción o situación. En el escenario de persecución descrito anteriormente, por ejemplo, los PCs podrían intentar algo para borrar segmentos del reloj Captura en lugar de llenar segmentos en el reloj Escape. Esto podría implicar dejar un falso rastro, bloquear una puerta o dividirse.
content.zh: 如果采取行动来扭转行动或情况，还可以擦除填充的时钟段。例如，在上面描述的追逐场景中，PC可能会尝试某些操作以清除捕获时钟上的段，而不是在逃生时钟上填充段。这可能涉及放置虚假轨迹，阻止门或分裂。
content.de: Gefüllte Uhrensegmente können auch gelöscht werden, wenn Maßnahmen ergriffen werden, um eine Aktion oder Situation umzukehren. Dies könnte das Ablegen einer falschen Spur, das Blockieren einer Tür oder das Aufteilen beinhalten.
content.fr: Les segments d’horloge remplis peuvent également être effacés si des mesures sont prises pour inverser une action ou une situation. Dans le scénario de poursuite décrit ci-dessus, par exemple, les PCs pourraient essayer quelque chose pour effacer des segments de l’horloge Capture au lieu de remplir des segments sur l’horloge Escape . Cela pourrait impliquer de déposer une fausse piste, de bloquer une porte ou de se diviser.
content.it: I segmenti dell’orologio riempiti possono anche essere cancellati se vengono intraprese azioni per invertire un’azione o una situazione. title.ja: ミッション、ダウンタイム、シーン

content.en:
Ongoing games of Lancer are usually divided into missions, each of which might encompass one play session or several, separated by periods of downtime. 

Missions have specific goals or objectives that can be completed within a discrete amount of time: destroying a building, breaking into a secure facility to recover vital data, evacuating civilians, uncovering a conspiracy, or holding the line against enemy attack, for example. Missions also provide some preparation time in which you can establish goals, stakes, and equipment for your characters. 

If your character isn’t on a mission, you’re in downtime. This is the narrative space between missions, in which moment-to-moment action doesn’t matter as much and roleplaying matters much more. During downtime you can progress plots, projects, or personal stories, moving the clock forward as much or as little as you want. Days, months, and even years can pass in downtime, depending on the pace of your game. 

In both missions and downtime, play is divided into scenes. A scene is a period of continuous dialogue, action, or activity that has a discrete starting and stopping point. This is called a scene because it’s helpful to think about it in cinematic terms: as long as the focus (or ‘camera’) is on the players and their action, a scene is happening. When the focus cuts away from the current scene, or the current action naturally ends, that’s when the scene should end too. 

A single combat encounter or a dialogue between characters are both great examples of scenes, but a scene can also be something like a montage. 

It’s important to pay attention to the beginning and end of scenes, as many special character and mech abilities end or reset at the end of a scene.
